intro: Gyrostemon spinosostipulatus, commonly known as the spiny-stipule gyrostemon, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spiny structures on its leaves and stems. The plant has small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a rough texture, with spines present at the base. Gyrostemon spinosostipulatus is adapted to dry environments and is often found in coastal regions.
